     2→title: "Webhooks"

     6→
     7→Webhooks enable you to trigger xpander.ai agents from any external system that can make HTTP requests. Each agent has a unique webhook URL for programmatic interaction.
     8→
     9→## Accessing Your Webhook URL
    10→
    11→<Frame caption="Agent Builder Interface">
    12→![Agent Builder Interface](/static/images/screenshots/36DB40C0-7033-4F84-8CB8-EA1FAD14C561.png)
    13→</Frame>
    14→
    15→To find your webhook URL:
    16→1. Navigate to your agent in the AI Agent Workbench
    17→2. Click the "Webhook" trigger in the top of the graph
    18→3. The Webhook Configuration panel will open, providing:
    19→   - Ready-to-use code snippets
    20→   - Configuration instructions
    21→   - Testing capabilities
    22→   - Webhook management options
    23→
    24→<Frame caption="Webhook Configuration Interface">
    25→![Webhook Configuration Interface](/static/images/screenshots/AECAB014-E97A-4D2C-BEDF-64118F45BD4D.png)
    26→</Frame>
    27→
    28→## Making Webhook Requests
    29→
    30→### Required Parameters
    31→
    32→| Parameter | Type | Description |
    33→| --------- | ---- | ----------- |
    34→| `agent_id` | string | The unique identifier of your agent |
    35→| `source_node_id` | string | The starting node ID in your agent's workflow |
    36→| `x-api-key` | string | Your API key for authentication (header or query parameter) |
    37→| `asynchronous` | boolean | Whether to wait for completion (`false`) or return immediately (`true`) |
    38→
    39→### Request Body Options
    40→
    41→| Option | Type | Description |
    42→| ------ | ---- | ----------- |
    43→| `files` | file | One or more files to process (PDF, PNG, JPEG, GIF, WEBP) |
    44→| `prompt` | string | A text prompt to send to the agent |
    45→
    46→<Warning>
    47→When uploading files, you must send the actual files using `multipart/form-data`. Direct external URLs to files are not supported as inputs. The platform will generate secure presigned URLs for your agent to access the uploaded files.
    48→</Warning>
    49→
    50→### Content Types
    51→
    52→- **With files**: Use `multipart/form-data` (curl handles this automatically with `--form`)
    53→- **JSON only**: Use `application/json` with the appropriate header
    54→
    55→## File Handling
    56→
    57→### Supported File Types
    58→
    59→xpander.ai supports a variety of file formats:
    60→- Documents: PDF
    61→- Images: PNG, JPEG, GIF, WEBP
    62→
    63→### Uploading Multiple Files
    64→
    65→To process multiple files in a single request:
    66→
    67→```bash
    68→curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=true" \
    69→--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
    70→--form "prompt=Process these documents" \
    71→--form "files=@/path/to/first-file.pdf" \
    72→--form "files=@/path/to/second-file.pdf" \
    73→--form "files=@/path/to/image.png" \
    74→--form "source_node_id=YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID" \
    75→--form "agent_id=YOUR_AGENT_ID"
    76→```
    77→
    78→For large batches of files (10+ files), we recommend:
    79→1. Using asynchronous mode (`asynchronous=true`)
    80→2. Breaking uploads into multiple requests of 5-10 files each
    81→3. Using a dedicated file uploader with retry capabilities
    82→
    83→### File URL Mechanism
    84→
    85→When you upload files through the webhook:
    86→
    87→1. xpander.ai automatically handles storage of your files
    88→2. Your agent receives secure presigned URLs to access these files
    89→3. These URLs remain valid for 30 days after upload
    90→4. Files are accessible only to your organization's agents
    91→
    92→<Info>
    93→All uploaded files are stored securely on our platform. Your agent doesn't need to handle file storage or download logic - it will automatically receive properly formatted URLs to access the files.
    94→</Info>
    95→
    96→## Synchronous vs Asynchronous Requests
    97→
    98→### Synchronous Mode
    99→
   100→```bash
   101→curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=false" \
   102→--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
   103→--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
   104→--data '{"source_node_id": "YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID", "agent_id": "YOUR_AGENT_ID", "prompt": "What can you do?"}'
   105→```
   106→
   107→- HTTP request remains open until agent completes
   108→- Returns complete execution details and results
   109→- Best for immediate responses and short tasks
   110→
   111→**Response:**
   112→
   113→```json
   114→{
   115→  "result": {
   116→    "id": "9642f5dd-e535-465f-bdaf-89be6ecaa2d5",
   117→    "status": "completed",
   118→    "result": "I specialize in extracting text from image and PDF files using Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technology. If you provide me with a file in a supported format (pdf, png, jpeg, gif, webp), I can extract the text content for you.",
   119→    "source": "webhook"
   120→  }
   121→}
   122→```
   123→
   124→### Asynchronous Mode
   125→
   126→```bash
   127→curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=true" \
   128→--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
   129→--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
   130→--data '{"source_node_id": "YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID", "agent_id": "YOUR_AGENT_ID", "prompt": "What can you do?"}'
   131→```
   132→
   133→- Returns immediately while agent processes in background
   134→- Best for long-running tasks and large file processing
   135→- Allows your application to continue execution
   136→
   137→**Response:**
   138→
   139→```json
   140→{
   141→  "result": "Started"
   142→}
   143→```
   144→
   145→## Example: OCR Document Processing
   146→
   147→This example shows how to extract text from a document using the OCR agent:
   148→
   149→```bash
   150→curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=false" \
   151→--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
   152→--form "prompt=Extract text from this document" \
   153→--form "files=@/path/to/your/document.pdf" \
   154→--form "source_node_id=YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID" \
   155→--form "agent_id=YOUR_AGENT_ID"
   156→```
   157→
   158→<Info>
   159→The OCR agent handles multiple document formats (PDFs and images) and preserves formatting when possible, including tables and structured content.
   160→</Info>
   161→
   162→### Sample OCR Result
   163→
   164→```json
   165→{
   166→  "result": {
   167→    "id": "07d6f375-53e9-4aa3-a7af-c36ce99a07d8",
   168→    "status": "completed",
   169→    "result": "## Financial Statement\n\n## ACCOUNT SUMMARY FOR PERIOD ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2024\n\n| Description | Amount | Percentage |\n|------------|--------|------------|\n| Opening Balance | 50,000 | - |\n| Deposits | 25,000 | - |\n| Withdrawals | (10,000) | - |\n| Fees | (1,500) | 3% |\n| Interest | 1,200 | 2.4% |\n| Closing Balance | 64,700 | - |",
   170→    "source": "webhook"
   171→  }
   172→}
   173→```
   174→
   175→## Monitoring Webhook Activity
   176→
   177→xpander.ai provides a comprehensive monitoring interface for webhook calls:
   178→
   179→<Frame caption="Webhook Monitoring Interface">
   180→![OCR Agent Monitoring Interface](/static/images/screenshots/858B1698-A13F-4B6B-9ADB-71629B4BD261.png)
   181→</Frame>
   182→
   183→The monitoring dashboard displays:
   184→- Complete execution logs
   185→- File processing details
   186→- Performance metrics
   187→- Full request/response data
   188→
   189→## Common Use Cases
   190→
   191→<CardGroup cols={2}>
   192→  <Card title="Workflow Automation" icon="robot">
   193→    Integrate with platforms like Zapier, Make.com, or n8n to trigger document processing based on external events.
   194→  </Card>
   195→  
   196→  <Card title="Document Processing" icon="file-pdf">
   197→    Extract structured data from documents to automate data entry and analysis workflows.
   198→  </Card>
   199→</CardGroup>

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
---
title: "Webhooks"
description: "Connect external systems to your agents using webhook endpoints"
icon: "webhook"
---

Webhooks enable you to trigger xpander.ai agents from any external system that can make HTTP requests. Each agent has a unique webhook URL for programmatic interaction.

## Accessing Your Webhook URL

<Frame caption="Agent Builder Interface">
![Agent Builder Interface](/static/images/screenshots/36DB40C0-7033-4F84-8CB8-EA1FAD14C561.png)
</Frame>

To find your webhook URL:
1. Navigate to your agent in the AI Agent Workbench
2. Click the "Webhook" trigger in the top of the graph
3. The Webhook Configuration panel will open, providing:
   - Ready-to-use code snippets
   - Configuration instructions
   - Testing capabilities
   - Webhook management options

<Frame caption="Webhook Configuration Interface">
![Webhook Configuration Interface](/static/images/screenshots/AECAB014-E97A-4D2C-BEDF-64118F45BD4D.png)
</Frame>

## Making Webhook Requests

### Required Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Description |
| --------- | ---- | ----------- |
| `agent_id` | string | The unique identifier of your agent |
| `source_node_id` | string | The starting node ID in your agent's workflow |
| `x-api-key` | string | Your API key for authentication (header or query parameter) |
| `asynchronous` | boolean | Whether to wait for completion (`false`) or return immediately (`true`) |

### Request Body Options

| Option | Type | Description |
| ------ | ---- | ----------- |
| `files` | file | One or more files to process (PDF, PNG, JPEG, GIF, WEBP) |
| `prompt` | string | A text prompt to send to the agent |

<Warning>
When uploading files, you must send the actual files using `multipart/form-data`. Direct external URLs to files are not supported as inputs. The platform will generate secure presigned URLs for your agent to access the uploaded files.
</Warning>

### Content Types

- **With files**: Use `multipart/form-data` (curl handles this automatically with `--form`)
- **JSON only**: Use `application/json` with the appropriate header

## File Handling

### Supported File Types

xpander.ai supports a variety of file formats:
- Documents: PDF
- Images: PNG, JPEG, GIF, WEBP

### Uploading Multiple Files

To process multiple files in a single request:

```bash
curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=true" \
--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
--form "prompt=Process these documents" \
--form "files=@/path/to/first-file.pdf" \
--form "files=@/path/to/second-file.pdf" \
--form "files=@/path/to/image.png" \
--form "source_node_id=YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID" \
--form "agent_id=YOUR_AGENT_ID"
```

For large batches of files (10+ files), we recommend:
1. Using asynchronous mode (`asynchronous=true`)
2. Breaking uploads into multiple requests of 5-10 files each
3. Using a dedicated file uploader with retry capabilities

### File URL Mechanism

When you upload files through the webhook:

1. xpander.ai automatically handles storage of your files
2. Your agent receives secure presigned URLs to access these files
3. These URLs remain valid for 30 days after upload
4. Files are accessible only to your organization's agents

<Info>
All uploaded files are stored securely on our platform. Your agent doesn't need to handle file storage or download logic - it will automatically receive properly formatted URLs to access the files.
</Info>

## Synchronous vs Asynchronous Requests

### Synchronous Mode

```bash
curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=false" \
--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data '{"source_node_id": "YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID", "agent_id": "YOUR_AGENT_ID", "prompt": "What can you do?"}'
```

- HTTP request remains open until agent completes
- Returns complete execution details and results
- Best for immediate responses and short tasks

**Response:**

```json
{
  "result": {
    "id": "9642f5dd-e535-465f-bdaf-89be6ecaa2d5",
    "status": "completed",
    "result": "I specialize in extracting text from image and PDF files using Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technology. If you provide me with a file in a supported format (pdf, png, jpeg, gif, webp), I can extract the text content for you.",
    "source": "webhook"
  }
}
```

### Asynchronous Mode

```bash
curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=true" \
--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data '{"source_node_id": "YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID", "agent_id": "YOUR_AGENT_ID", "prompt": "What can you do?"}'
```

- Returns immediately while agent processes in background
- Best for long-running tasks and large file processing
- Allows your application to continue execution

**Response:**

```json
{
  "result": "Started"
}
```

## Example: OCR Document Processing

This example shows how to extract text from a document using the OCR agent:

```bash
curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=false" \
--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
--form "prompt=Extract text from this document" \
--form "files=@/path/to/your/document.pdf" \
--form "source_node_id=YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID" \
--form "agent_id=YOUR_AGENT_ID"
```

<Info>
The OCR agent handles multiple document formats (PDFs and images) and preserves formatting when possible, including tables and structured content.
</Info>

### Sample OCR Result

```json
{
  "result": {
    "id": "07d6f375-53e9-4aa3-a7af-c36ce99a07d8",
    "status": "completed",
    "result": "## Financial Statement\n\n## ACCOUNT SUMMARY FOR PERIOD ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2024\n\n| Description | Amount | Percentage |\n|------------|--------|------------|\n| Opening Balance | 50,000 | - |\n| Deposits | 25,000 | - |\n| Withdrawals | (10,000) | - |\n| Fees | (1,500) | 3% |\n| Interest | 1,200 | 2.4% |\n| Closing Balance | 64,700 | - |",
    "source": "webhook"
  }
}
```

## Monitoring Webhook Activity

xpander.ai provides a comprehensive monitoring interface for webhook calls:

<Frame caption="Webhook Monitoring Interface">
![OCR Agent Monitoring Interface](/static/images/screenshots/858B1698-A13F-4B6B-9ADB-71629B4BD261.png)
</Frame>

The monitoring dashboard displays:
- Complete execution logs
- File processing details
- Performance metrics
- Full request/response data

## Common Use Cases

<CardGroup cols={2}>
  <Card title="Workflow Automation" icon="robot">
    Integrate with platforms like Zapier, Make.com, or n8n to trigger document processing based on external events.
  </Card>
  
  <Card title="Document Processing" icon="file-pdf">
    Extract structured data from documents to automate data entry and analysis workflows.
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

---
title: "Webhooks"
description: "Connect external systems to your agents using webhook endpoints"
icon: "webhook"
---

Webhooks enable you to trigger xpander.ai agents from any external system that can make HTTP requests. Each agent has a unique webhook URL for programmatic interaction.

## Accessing Your Webhook URL

<Frame caption="Agent Builder Interface">
![Agent Builder Interface](/static/images/screenshots/36DB40C0-7033-4F84-8CB8-EA1FAD14C561.png)
</Frame>

To find your webhook URL:
1. Navigate to your agent in the AI Agent Workbench
2. Click the "Webhook" trigger in the top of the graph
3. The Webhook Configuration panel will open, providing:
   - Ready-to-use code snippets
   - Configuration instructions
   - Testing capabilities
   - Webhook management options

<Frame caption="Webhook Configuration Interface">
![Webhook Configuration Interface](/static/images/screenshots/AECAB014-E97A-4D2C-BEDF-64118F45BD4D.png)
</Frame>

## Making Webhook Requests

### Required Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Description |
| --------- | ---- | ----------- |
| `agent_id` | string | The unique identifier of your agent |
| `source_node_id` | string | The starting node ID in your agent's workflow |
| `x-api-key` | string | Your API key for authentication (header or query parameter) |
| `asynchronous` | boolean | Whether to wait for completion (`false`) or return immediately (`true`) |

### Request Body Options

| Option | Type | Description |
| ------ | ---- | ----------- |
| `files` | file | One or more files to process (PDF, PNG, JPEG, GIF, WEBP) |
| `prompt` | string | A text prompt to send to the agent |

<Warning>
When uploading files, you must send the actual files using `multipart/form-data`. Direct external URLs to files are not supported as inputs. The platform will generate secure presigned URLs for your agent to access the uploaded files.
</Warning>

### Content Types

- **With files**: Use `multipart/form-data` (curl handles this automatically with `--form`)
- **JSON only**: Use `application/json` with the appropriate header

## File Handling

### Supported File Types

xpander.ai supports a variety of file formats:
- Documents: PDF
- Images: PNG, JPEG, GIF, WEBP

### Uploading Multiple Files

To process multiple files in a single request:

```bash
curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=true" \
--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
--form "prompt=Process these documents" \
--form "files=@/path/to/first-file.pdf" \
--form "files=@/path/to/second-file.pdf" \
--form "files=@/path/to/image.png" \
--form "source_node_id=YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID" \
--form "agent_id=YOUR_AGENT_ID"
```

For large batches of files (10+ files), we recommend:
1. Using asynchronous mode (`asynchronous=true`)
2. Breaking uploads into multiple requests of 5-10 files each
3. Using a dedicated file uploader with retry capabilities

### File URL Mechanism

When you upload files through the webhook:

1. xpander.ai automatically handles storage of your files
2. Your agent receives secure presigned URLs to access these files
3. These URLs remain valid for 30 days after upload
4. Files are accessible only to your organization's agents

<Info>
All uploaded files are stored securely on our platform. Your agent doesn't need to handle file storage or download logic - it will automatically receive properly formatted URLs to access the files.
</Info>

## Synchronous vs Asynchronous Requests

### Synchronous Mode

```bash
curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=false" \
--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data '{"source_node_id": "YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID", "agent_id": "YOUR_AGENT_ID", "prompt": "What can you do?"}'
```

- HTTP request remains open until agent completes
- Returns complete execution details and results
- Best for immediate responses and short tasks

**Response:**

```json
{
  "result": {
    "id": "9642f5dd-e535-465f-bdaf-89be6ecaa2d5",
    "status": "completed",
    "result": "I specialize in extracting text from image and PDF files using Optical Character Recognition (OCR) technology. If you provide me with a file in a supported format (pdf, png, jpeg, gif, webp), I can extract the text content for you.",
    "source": "webhook"
  }
}
```

### Asynchronous Mode

```bash
curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=true" \
--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
--header "Content-Type: application/json" \
--data '{"source_node_id": "YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID", "agent_id": "YOUR_AGENT_ID", "prompt": "What can you do?"}'
```

- Returns immediately while agent processes in background
- Best for long-running tasks and large file processing
- Allows your application to continue execution

**Response:**

```json
{
  "result": "Started"
}
```

## Example: OCR Document Processing

This example shows how to extract text from a document using the OCR agent:

```bash
curl --location "https://webhook.xpander.ai?asynchronous=false" \
--header "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
--form "prompt=Extract text from this document" \
--form "files=@/path/to/your/document.pdf" \
--form "source_node_id=YOUR_SOURCE_NODE_ID" \
--form "agent_id=YOUR_AGENT_ID"
```

<Info>
The OCR agent handles multiple document formats (PDFs and images) and preserves formatting when possible, including tables and structured content.
</Info>

### Sample OCR Result

```json
{
  "result": {
    "id": "07d6f375-53e9-4aa3-a7af-c36ce99a07d8",
    "status": "completed",
    "result": "## Financial Statement\n\n## ACCOUNT SUMMARY FOR PERIOD ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2024\n\n| Description | Amount | Percentage |\n|------------|--------|------------|\n| Opening Balance | 50,000 | - |\n| Deposits | 25,000 | - |\n| Withdrawals | (10,000) | - |\n| Fees | (1,500) | 3% |\n| Interest | 1,200 | 2.4% |\n| Closing Balance | 64,700 | - |",
    "source": "webhook"
  }
}
```

## Monitoring Webhook Activity

xpander.ai provides a comprehensive monitoring interface for webhook calls:

<Frame caption="Webhook Monitoring Interface">
![OCR Agent Monitoring Interface](/static/images/screenshots/858B1698-A13F-4B6B-9ADB-71629B4BD261.png)
</Frame>

The monitoring dashboard displays:
- Complete execution logs
- File processing details
- Performance metrics
- Full request/response data

## Common Use Cases

<CardGroup cols={2}>
  <Card title="Workflow Automation" icon="robot">
    Integrate with platforms like Zapier, Make.com, or n8n to trigger document processing based on external events.
  </Card>
  
  <Card title="Document Processing" icon="file-pdf">
    Extract structured data from documents to automate data entry and analysis workflows.
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

| `x-api-key` | string | Your API key for authentication (header or query parameter) |
| `asynchronous` | boolean | Whether to wait for completion (`false`) or return immediately (`true`) |
- HTTP request remains open until agent completes
- Returns immediately while agent processes in background

file.content:
### Required Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Description |
| --------- | ---- | ----------- |
| `agent_id` | string | The unique identifier of your agent |
| `x-api-key` | string | Your API key for authentication (header or query parameter) |
| `asynchronous` | boolean | Whether to wait for completion (`false`) or return immediately (`true`) |

### Request Body Options

| Option | Type | Description |
| ------ | ---- | ----------- |
| `files` | file | One or more files to process (PDF, PNG, JPEG, GIF, WEBP) |
| `prompt` | string | A text prompt to send to the agent |

<Warning>
When uploading files, you must send the actual files using `multipart/form-data`. Direct external URLs to files are not supported as inputs. The platform will generate secure presigned URLs for your agent to access the uploaded files.
</Warning>

### Content Types
